medicines.name: Paracetamol
medicines.description1: Paracetamol is commonly used to relieve mild to moderate pain and reduce fever. It is effective for headaches, muscle aches, and toothaches. Unlike NSAIDs, it does not reduce inflammation.
medicines.description2: It is well-tolerated but should be used with caution in those with liver conditions. Overdosing can lead to liver damage.
medicines.description3: Take every 4-6 hours as needed but do not exceed 4,000 mg per day. Consult a doctor if you have liver issues or consume alcohol regularly.
medicines.warnings: Avoid if allergic to acetaminophen. Do not exceed the recommended dose to prevent liver damage.
medicines.when_to_take: Can be taken every 4-6 hours as needed. Do not exceed 4,000 mg per day.

medicines.name: Disprine
medicines.description1: Disprine relieves pain and inflammation from arthritis, muscle pain, and menstrual cramps. It contains acetylsalicylic acid, which blocks pain-causing substances in the body.
medicines.description2: It is effective for temporary relief but use cautiously if you have gastrointestinal issues or aspirin allergies. Long-term use may cause complications.
medicines.description3: Follow dosing guidelines to avoid side effects. Consult a doctor if you have gastrointestinal problems or are pregnant.
medicines.warnings: Avoid in case of aspirin allergy. Consult your doctor if you have gastrointestinal issues or are pregnant.
medicines.when_to_take: Take as directed, usually every 4-6 hours as needed, but do not exceed the recommended dose.

medicines.name: Diclo Wins Plus
medicines.description1: Diclo Wins Plus combines diclofenac with other agents to relieve pain and inflammation from conditions like arthritis and muscle pain. It reduces pain and swelling.
medicines.description2: The medication may cause gastrointestinal discomfort or kidney issues if used long-term. Use as directed and consult a doctor for underlying health conditions.
medicines.description3: Take with food to reduce stomach upset. Follow the dosage instructions provided by your doctor.
medicines.warnings: Not recommended for patients with gastrointestinal problems. Use with caution if you have renal impairment.
medicines.when_to_take: Take with food to minimize stomach upset. Follow the dosage instructions provided by your doctor.

medicines.name: Combiflam
medicines.description1: Combiflam combines ibuprofen and paracetamol to provide pain relief and reduce inflammation. It is effective for headaches, muscle pain, and menstrual cramps.
medicines.description2: The dual action helps address pain and inflammation. Use with caution in individuals with gastrointestinal or renal issues.
medicines.description3: Take every 6-8 hours as needed. Do not exceed the recommended dose to avoid adverse effects.
medicines.warnings: Do not use if allergic to NSAIDs or if you have gastrointestinal problems. Use only as directed.
medicines.when_to_take: Take every 6-8 hours as needed. Do not exceed the recommended dose to prevent side effects.

medicines.name: Nomokes
medicines.description1: Nomokes is an NSAID used to relieve pain and inflammation from arthritis and muscle pain. It helps reduce pain and swelling.
medicines.description2: It should be taken with food to avoid stomach upset. Long-term use requires medical supervision due to potential side effects.
medicines.description3: Monitor for gastrointestinal or renal side effects and consult a doctor if you have pre-existing conditions.
medicines.warnings: Avoid if allergic to any component. Consult a doctor if pregnant, breastfeeding, or have pre-existing conditions.
medicines.when_to_take: Follow the dosage instructions provided by your healthcare provider, usually with food.

medicines.name: Vicksaction 500
medicines.description1: Vicksaction 500 alleviates cold and flu symptoms like congestion, cough, and sore throat. It combines multiple ingredients for relief.
medicines.description2: Use according to instructions to avoid overuse. Be cautious of potential drowsiness.
medicines.description3: Consult a doctor if symptoms persist or if you have other health concerns.
medicines.warnings: May cause drowsiness. Avoid in children under 12 years. Consult a doctor for prolonged symptoms.
medicines.when_to_take: Take every 4-6 hours as needed. Do not exceed the maximum daily dose.

medicines.name: Avil
medicines.description1: Avil is an antihistamine used for allergic reactions, reducing symptoms like sneezing, itching, and rashes. It can cause drowsiness.
medicines.description2: Avoid operating vehicles or machinery due to potential sedative effects. Alcohol can enhance these effects.
medicines.description3: Consult with your healthcare provider for appropriate use and potential interactions with other medications.
medicines.warnings: May cause drowsiness. Avoid alcohol. Consult your doctor if you have chronic conditions.
medicines.when_to_take: Typically taken once or twice daily as needed for allergy symptoms.

medicines.name: Citragen
medicines.description1: Citragen provides relief from gastric discomfort and indigestion by neutralizing stomach acid and alleviating heartburn.
medicines.description2: It should be taken after meals to aid digestion and prevent discomfort. Follow dosing recommendations carefully.
medicines.description3: Consult with a healthcare provider if symptoms persist or if you have gastrointestinal issues.
medicines.warnings: Use with caution in individuals with gastrointestinal disorders. Follow dosage instructions.
medicines.when_to_take: Take after meals as needed for relief from indigestion.

medicines.name: Meftalspas
medicines.description1: Meftalspas relieves menstrual pain and muscle spasms by combining mefenamic acid with other ingredients for pain relief.
medicines.description2: It reduces inflammation and eases muscle tension. Take with food to minimize stomach upset.
medicines.description3: Long-term use should be monitored by a healthcare provider to avoid potential gastrointestinal issues.
medicines.warnings: Avoid if allergic to any component. Consult your doctor if you have a history of gastrointestinal issues.
medicines.when_to_take: Take with food according to the dosage instructions on the label or as directed by your doctor.

medicines.name: Nimesilide
medicines.description1: Nimesilide is an NSAID for pain relief and inflammation from osteoarthritis and musculoskeletal pain. It reduces fever and pain.
medicines.description2: Use short-term due to potential liver toxicity. Regular monitoring is recommended for prolonged use.
medicines.description3: Usually taken twice daily, preferably after meals. Consult a healthcare provider for long-term use.
medicines.warnings: Not recommended for long-term use. Avoid in cases of liver impairment or other significant health issues.
medicines.when_to_take: Usually taken twice daily, preferably after meals.

medicines.name: Sinarest Tablets
medicines.description1: Sinarest Tablets relieve symptoms of sinusitis and respiratory conditions like nasal congestion and sinus pain.
medicines.description2: They address symptoms such as cough and runny nose. Be cautious of potential drowsiness.
medicines.description3: Consult your doctor if symptoms persist or if you have other health concerns.
medicines.warnings: May cause drowsiness. Avoid in children under 12 years and consult a doctor for prolonged symptoms.
medicines.when_to_take: Take as directed, usually every 4-6 hours as needed.

medicines.name: Sinarest Cough Syrup
medicines.description1: Sinarest Cough Syrup soothes cough and throat irritation from respiratory infections or allergies. It reduces cough frequency.
medicines.description2: Effective for dry, irritating coughs. Follow dosing instructions carefully.
medicines.description3: Consult a healthcare provider if symptoms persist or worsen.
medicines.warnings: May cause drowsiness. Avoid in children under 6 years. Consult a doctor if symptoms persist.
medicines.when_to_take: Usually taken every 6-8 hours as needed, but do not exceed the recommended dose.

medicines.name: Aspirin
medicines.description1: Aspirin reduces fever, pain, and inflammation, and is used in low doses to prevent heart attacks and strokes.
medicines.description2: It works by inhibiting pain-causing chemicals in the body. Use cautiously if you have gastrointestinal issues or bleeding disorders.
medicines.description3: Take with food to minimize stomach irritation. Follow dosing instructions to avoid side effects.
medicines.warnings: Avoid if allergic to aspirin or if you have gastrointestinal bleeding issues. Not recommended for children with viral infections.
medicines.when_to_take: Take with food to minimize stomach irritation. Follow the prescribed dosage to avoid potential side effects.

medicines.name: Ibuprofen
medicines.description1: Ibuprofen is an NSAID used to relieve pain, reduce fever, and decrease inflammation. Commonly used for headaches, muscle aches, and arthritis.
medicines.description2: It blocks prostaglandins, which cause inflammation and pain. Use with caution in individuals with gastrointestinal, kidney, or heart conditions.
medicines.description3: Take every 4-6 hours as needed. Do not exceed the maximum daily dose to avoid side effects.
medicines.warnings: Avoid if you have a history of gastrointestinal issues, kidney problems, or heart disease. Consult your doctor before use if you have underlying conditions.
medicines.when_to_take: Take every 4-6 hours as needed. Do not exceed the maximum daily dose to avoid side effects.

medicines.name: Claritin
medicines.description1: Claritin is an antihistamine that alleviates allergy symptoms like sneezing, runny nose, and itchy eyes. It generally does not cause drowsiness.
medicines.description2: It blocks histamine to reduce allergy symptoms. Some individuals may experience drowsiness.
medicines.description3: Follow the dosage instructions carefully and consult a healthcare provider if symptoms persist.
medicines.warnings: May cause drowsiness in some people. Avoid alcohol and consult your doctor if you have chronic health conditions.
medicines.when_to_take: Usually taken once daily. Follow the dosage instructions on the label or as directed by your healthcare provider.

medicines.name: Tetan-20
medicines.description1: Tetan-20 is a tetanus booster vaccine recommended every 10 years to protect against tetanus infection.
medicines.description2: Tetanus is a serious bacterial infection that affects the nervous system. The vaccine is crucial for maintaining immunity.
medicines.description3: Consult with a healthcare provider to ensure timely vaccinations and boosters, especially after injuries.
medicines.warnings: Consult your doctor if you have a history of severe allergic reactions to vaccines or other health concerns.
medicines.when_to_take: Typically administered every 10 years for continued protection against tetanus.

medicines.name: Petril-MD 0.25
medicines.description1: Petril-MD 0.25 is used for managing anxiety and panic attacks by modulating brain chemistry.
medicines.description2: It provides relief from excessive worry and stress but may cause drowsiness or dizziness.
medicines.description3: Use caution when performing tasks requiring alertness. Consult with a healthcare provider for dosage adjustments or side effects.
medicines.warnings: May cause drowsiness and dizziness. Avoid alcohol and other central nervous system depressants. Consult your doctor if you have a history of psychiatric disorders.
medicines.when_to_take: Take as prescribed by your healthcare provider, usually once or twice daily.

medicines.name: Rabiros-D
medicines.description1: Rabiros-D manages symptoms of GERD and other acid-related conditions by reducing stomach acid and improving gastrointestinal motility.
medicines.description2: It helps alleviate symptoms like heartburn and regurgitation. Use it as directed for effective relief.
medicines.description3: Consult with a healthcare provider for potential interactions and if symptoms persist.
medicines.warnings: Consult your doctor if you have liver disease or are taking other medications. Follow the prescribed dosage.
medicines.when_to_take: Typically taken once daily before a meal for optimal effectiveness.
